standard_metadata.standard_description: Use decimal notation for fractions with denominators 10 or 100.

hints.content: Let's use a picture to see what $\blue{ 14 \text{ hundredths}}$ looks like.  The big square below represents one whole, and each little square represents one hundredth.     [[☃ image 1]]  $\blue{ 14 \text{ hundredths}}$ are shaded.

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. All the squares in the first column and the bottom 4 squares in the second column are shaded.

hints.content: $\blue{ 14 \text{ hundredths}}$ is the same as $\pink{1 \text{ tenth}}$ and $\green{4 \text{ hundredths}}$.    [[☃ image 1]]    [[☃ image 2]]    [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: Three equal-sized squares. The first square is divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. All the squares in the first column and the bottom 4 squares in the second column are shaded. An equal sign is set after the square.
The second square is divided into 10 equal-size columns. The first column is shaded pink. A plus sign is set after the square.
The third square is divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. The bottom 4 squares in the second column are shaded green.

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to write $\pink{1 \text{ tenth}}$ and $\green{4 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\pink{1}$ | $\green{4}$
$14$ hundredths written as a decimal is $0.14$.

Let's use a picture to see what $\blue{ 92 \text{ hundredths}}$ looks like.  The big square below represents one whole, and each little square represents one hundredth.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blue{ 92 \text{ hundredths}}$ are shaded.

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in  10 columns of 10 squares each. The left nine columns are shaded blue. In the tenth column, the bottom two squares are shaded blue.

hints.content: $\blue{ 92 \text{ hundredths}}$ is the same as $\pink{9 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{2 \text{ hundredths}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]   [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: Three equal-sized squares. The first square is divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. All the squares in the first nine columns and the bottom 2 squares in the tenth column are shaded. An equal sign is set after the square.
The second square is divided into 10 equal-size columns. The first nine columns are shaded pink. A plus sign is set after the square.
The third square is divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. The bottom 2 squares in the tenth column are shaded green.

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to write $\pink{9 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{2 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\pink{9}$ | $\green{2}$
$92$ hundredths written as a decimal is $0.92$.

Let's use a picture to see what $\blue{ 25 \text{ hundredths}}$ looks like.  The big square below represents one whole, and each little square represents one hundredth.   [[☃ image 1]]  $\blue{ 25 \text{ hundredths}}$ are shaded.

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in  10 columns of 10 squares each. The left two columns are shaded blue. In the third column, the bottom five squares are shaded blue.

hints.content: $\blue{ 25 \text{ hundredths}}$ is the same as $\pink{2 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{5 \text{ hundredths}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]   [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: Three equal-sized squares. The first square is divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. All the squares in the first two columns and the bottom 5 squares in the third column are shaded. An equal sign is set after the square.
The second square is divided into 10 equal-size columns. The first two columns are shaded pink. A plus sign is set after the square.
The third square is divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. The bottom 5 squares in the third column are shaded green.

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to write $\pink{2 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{5 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\pink{2}$ | $\green{5}$
$25$ hundredths written as a decimal is $0.25$.

The second square is divided into 10 equal-size columns. The first eight columns are shaded pink. A plus sign is set after the square.
The third square is divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. The bottom 7 squares in the ninth column are shaded green.

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to write $\pink{8 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{7 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\pink{8}$ | $\green{7}$
$87$ hundredths written as a decimal is $0.87$.

Let's use a picture to see what $\blue{\text{eighteen hundredths}}$ looks like.  The big square below represents one whole, and each little square represents one hundredth.     [[☃ image 1]]  $\blue{ 18 \text{ hundredths}}$ are shaded.

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in  10 columns of 10 squares each. The left  column is shaded blue. In the second column, the bottom eight squares are shaded blue.

hints.content: $\blue{ 18 \text{ hundredths}}$ is the same as $\pink{1 \text{ tenth}}$ and $\green{8 \text{ hundredths}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]   [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: Three equal-sized squares. The first square is divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. All the squares in the first column and the bottom 8 squares in the second column are shaded. An equal sign is set after the square.
The second square is divided into 10 equal-size columns. The first column is shaded pink. A plus sign is set after the square.
The third square is divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. The bottom 8 squares in the second column are shaded green.

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to write $\pink{1 \text{ tenth}}$ and $\green{8 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\pink{1}$ | $\green{8}$
Eighteen hundredths written as a decimal is $0.18$.

Let's use a picture to see what $\blue{\text{twenty-three hundredths}}$ looks like.  The big square below represents one whole, and each little square represents one hundredth.     [[☃ image 1]]  $\blue{ 23 \text{ hundredths}}$ are shaded.

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in  10 columns of 10 squares each. The left two columns are shaded blue. In the third column, the bottom three squares are shaded blue.

hints.content: $\blue{ 23 \text{ hundredths}}$ is the same as $\pink{2 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{3 \text{ hundredths}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]   [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: Three equal-sized squares. The first square is divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. All the squares in the first two columns and the bottom 3 squares in the third column are shaded. An equal sign is set after the square.
The second square is divided into 10 equal-size columns. The first two columns are shaded pink. A plus sign is set after the square.
The third square is divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. The bottom 3 squares in the third column are shaded green.

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to write $\pink{2 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{3 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\pink{2}$ | $\green{3}$
Twenty-three hundredths written as a decimal is $0.23$.

Let's use a picture to see what $\blue{\text{forty-seven hundredths}}$ looks like.  The big square below represents one whole, and each little square represents one hundredth.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blue{ 47 \text{ hundredths}}$ are shaded.

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in  10 columns of 10 squares each. The left four columns are shaded blue. In the fifth column, the bottom seven squares are shaded blue.

hints.content: $\blue{ 47 \text{ hundredths}}$ is the same as $\pink{4 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{7 \text{ hundredths}}$.  [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]   [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: Three equal-sized squares. The first square is divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. All the squares in the first four columns and the bottom seven squares in the tenth column are shaded. An equal sign is set after the square.
The second square is divided into 10 equal-size columns. The first four columns are shaded pink. A plus sign is set after the square.
The third square is divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. The bottom seven squares in the fifth column are shaded green.

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to write $\pink{4 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{7 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\pink{4}$ | $\green{7}$
Forty-seven hundredths written as a decimal is $0.47$.

Let's use a picture to see what $\blue{\text{ninety-nine hundredths}}$ looks like.  The big square below represents one whole, and each little square represents one hundredth.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blue{ 99 \text{ hundredths}}$ are shaded.

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in  10 columns of 10 squares each. The left nine columns are shaded blue. In the tenth column, the bottom nine squares are shaded blue.

hints.content: $\blue{ 99 \text{ hundredths}}$ is the same as $\pink{9 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{9 \text{ hundredths}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]   [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: Three equal-sized squares. The first square is divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. All the squares in the first nine columns and the bottom nine squares in the tenth column are shaded. An equal sign is set after the square.
The second square is divided into 10 equal-size columns. The first nine columns are shaded pink. A plus sign is set after the square.
The third square is divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in 10 columns of 10 squares each. The bottom nine squares in the tenth column are shaded green.

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to write $\pink{9 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{9 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\pink{9}$ | $\green{9}$
Ninety-nine hundredths written as a decimal is $0.99$.
We can use a place value chart to help us write $\green{5 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.
$5$ hundredths written as a decimal is $0.05$.
We can use a place value chart to help us write $\green{2 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.
$2$ hundredths written as a decimal is $0.02$.

question.content: **Write $3$ tenths and $9$ hundredths as a decimal.**

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to help us write $\blue{3 \text{ tenths}}$ and $\green{9 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.
$3$ tenths and $9$ hundredths written as a decimal is $0.39$.

question.content: **Write $3$ ones $4$ tenths and $2$ hundredths as a decimal.**

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to help us write $\pink{3 \text{ ones}}$, $\blue{4 \text{ tenths}}$, and $\green{2 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.
$3$ ones $4$ tenths and $2$ hundredths written as a decimal is $3.42$.

question.content: **Write $2$ ones and $5$ hundredths as a decimal.**

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to help us write $\pink{2 \text{ ones}}$ and $\green{5 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.
$2$ ones and $5$ hundredths written as a decimal is $2.05$.

question.content: **Write $4$ tens and $3$ hundredths as a decimal.**

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to help us write $\purple{4 \text{ tens}}$ and $\green{3 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.
$4$ tens and $3$ hundredths written as a decimal is $40.03$.

question.content: **Write $2$ tens and $7$ tenths as a decimal.**

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to help us write $\purple{2 \text{ tens}}$ and $\blue{7 \text{ tenths}}$ as a decimal.
$2$ tens and $7$ tenths written as a decimal is $20.7$.

question.content: **Write $3$ tens and $5$ tenths as a decimal.**

hints.content: We can use a place value chart to help us write $\purple{3 \text{ tens}}$ and $\blue{5 \text{ tenths}}$ as a decimal.
$3$ tens and $5$ tenths written as a decimal is $30.5$.
Let's write $\blue{0.7}$ in a place value chart.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\blue0$|$\blue.$  | $\blue{7}$ |
From the chart, we see that $\blue{0.7} =\blue{7 \text{ tenths}}$.
We can write $0.7$ in words as $7$ tenths.
Let's write $\blue{0.4}$ in a place value chart.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\blue0$|$\blue.$  | $\blue{4}$ |
From the chart, we see that $\blue{0.4} =\blue{4 \text{ tenths}}$.
We can write $0.4$ in words as $4$ tenths.
Let's write $\blue{0.03}$ in a place value chart.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\blue0$|$\blue.$  | $\blue{0}$ | $\blue{3}$
From the chart, we see that $\blue{0.03} =\blue{3 \text{ hundredths}}$.
We can write $0.03$ in words as $3$ hundredths.
Let's write $0.17$ in a place value chart.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$\blue.$  | $\blue{1}$ | $\green{7}$
From the chart, we see:  ${0.17} =\blue{ 1\text{ tenth}}$ and $\green{7 \text{ hundredths}}$
We can write $0.17$ in words as $1$ tenth and $7$ hundredths.
Let's write $2.7$ in a place value chart.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\pink2$|$.$  | $\blue{7}$ |
From the chart, we see:  ${2.7} =\pink{2 \text{ ones}}$ and $\blue{7 \text{ tenths}}$
$\phantom{\blue{2.7}} =\pink{\text{Two}}$ and $\blue{\text{seven tenths}}$
We can write $2.7$ in words as two and seven tenths.
Let's write $5.04$ in a place value chart.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\pink5$|$.$  |$0$| $\green{4}$
From the chart, we see:  ${5.04} =\pink{5 \text{ ones}}$ and $\green{4 \text{ hundredths}}$
$\phantom{{5.04}} =\pink{\text{Five}}$ and $\green{\text{four hundredths}}$
We can write $5.04$ in words as five and four hundredths.
Let's write $50.2$ in a place value chart.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $\purple5~~~~~$|$0$|$.$  |$\blue2$|
From the chart, we see:  $50.2 =\purple{5 \text{ tens}}$ and $\blue{2 \text{ tenths}}$
$\phantom{\blue{50.2}} =\purple{\text{Fifty}}$ and $\blue{\text{two tenths}}$
We can write $50.2$ in words as fifty and two tenths.
Let's write $20.08$ in a place value chart.  Tens$~~~~~$|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $\purple2~~~~~$|$0$|$.$  |$0$| $\green8$
From the chart, we see:  $20.08 =\purple{2 \text{ tens}}$ and $\green{8 \text{ hundredths}}$
$\phantom{\blue{20.08}} =\purple{\text{Twenty}}$ and $\green{\text{eight hundredths}}$
We can write $20.08$ in words as twenty and eight hundredths.
